column1: Art Institute of Chicago////I won't describe the pieces of art here since my kudos in that regard belongs to the artists and not the museum.  However
column2: the museum does a fantastic job of tailoring the rooms that house the pieces to the style of the pieces themselves.  For instance
column3: they had an exhibit on modern Japanese fashion and when you went into that room
column4: the whole room was painted black with low lighting and many wooden vertical black beams arranged in an open space like a courtyard (or
column6: an abstract forest) with the fashion pieces in the distance along a wall.  The setup of the room was a work of art in itself.
